sentence.Network_cn: 他的写作得益于他感到已故的林肯一直在他身后激励着他。

sentence.Network_cn: 他被问及收入、债务以及是否有资格享受政府发放的救济金等问题。

entry.def: The benefit of something is the help that you get from it or the advantage that results from  it.

example.ex: Each family farms individually and reaps the benefit of its labor...
example.tran: 各家经营各自的农场，收获各自的劳动成果。

example.ex: I'm  a great believer in the benefits of this form of therapy...
example.tran: 我坚信这种治疗形式非常有益。

entry.def: If something is to your benefit or is of benefit to you, it helps you or improves your life.

example.ex: This could now work to Albania's  benefit...
example.tran: 这种情况目前对阿尔巴尼亚有利。

example.ex: I hope what I have written will be of benefit to someone else who may feel the same way.
example.tran: 我希望我所写的内容能对其他和我有同感的人有所裨益。

entry.def: If you benefit from something or if it benefits you, it helps you or improves your life.

example.ex: Both sides have benefited from the talks.
...a variety of government programs benefiting children.
example.tran: 有益于儿童的各种政府项目

entry.def: If you have the benefit of some information, knowledge, or equipment, you are able to use it so that you can achieve something.

example.ex: Steve didn't have the benefit of a formal college education...
example.tran: 史蒂夫没能接受正规的大学教育。

example.ex: With the benefit of hindsight, it is clear we ought to have done more...
example.tran: 事后看来，我们显然本该做得更多。

entry.tran: （政府提供给穷人、病人和失业人员的）救济金，补助金
entry.def: Benefit is money that is given by the government to people who are poor, ill, or unemployed.

example.ex: I was told that in order to get benefit payments I would have to answer some questions.
example.tran: 我得知要领补助，就得回答一些问题。

entry.def: A benefit, or a benefit concert or dinner, is an event that is held in order to raise money for a particular charity or person.

example.ex: I am organising a benefit gig in Bristol to raise these funds.
example.tran: 我要在布里斯托尔组织一场义演来募集这些资金。

entry.def: If you give someone the benefit of the doubt, you treat them as if they are telling the truth or as if they have behaved properly, even though you are not sure that this is the case.

example.ex: At first I gave him the benefit of the doubt...
Shalford is entitled to the benefit of the doubt.
example.tran: 沙尔福德暂且获得了信任。

entry.def: If you say that someone is doing something for the benefit of a particular person, you mean that they are doing it for that person.

example.ex: You need people working for the benefit of the community...
example.tran: 你们需要为社区谋利益的人。

example.ex: He doesn't have to go through this elaborate display for my benefit!
example.tran: 他不必为了我作这么详细的展示！

auth_sentence.content: He says the benefits of data visualisation are obvious.
auth_sentence.res_content: He says the benefits of data visualisation are obvious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He says the benefits of data visualisation are obvious.

auth_sentence.content: The benefits of breast milk for babies are numerous.
auth_sentence.res_content: The benefits of breast milk for babies are numerous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The benefits of breast milk for babies are numerous.

auth_sentence.content: But this statistical reasoning has both costs and benefits.
auth_sentence.res_content: But this statistical reasoning has both costs and benefits.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But this statistical reasoning has both costs and benefits.

Sentence.sentence: Third, there are benefits to trade.

When that flow is interrupted, we feel the pain in short supplies and higher prices, At the same time, we derive massive economic benefits when we buy the most affordable energy on the world market and when we engage in energy trade around the world

A study by researchers at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), Stanford University and Columbia University shows that even a modest decrease in daily salt intake (摄入) can lead to dramatic health benefits.
Many people now say the benefits of switching to vegetarian diet which excludes meat and fish.

Teenagers in Australia, similarly ,said that their mobile phones provided numerous benefits and were an affiliated part of their lives; some were so attached to their phones that the researchers considered it an addiction.
Schweitzer concedes his research runs counter to a very large body of literature that commends the many benefits of goal-setting.
